meanings.definition: Alkanes: A series of saturated hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH2n+2.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemistry textbooks often discuss the properties of alkanes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the alkanes refuse to react with other compounds? Because they were already content!
meanings.sent4: The alkanes stood in a neat row, each one holding hands with hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of alkanes makes them a great starting point for understanding hydrocarbons.

meanings.definition: Alkanes: A type of organic compound consisting entirely of single-bonded carbon and hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent1: My teacher explained that alkanes are made up of single-bonded carbon and hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician analyzed the structure of the alkanes under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: Why did the alkanes throw a party? Because they heard it was a bonding experience!
meanings.sent4: The alkanes danced together, forming a strong and stable molecular chain.
meanings.sent5: In the world of organic chemistry, alkanes play a fundamental role in many reactions.
